citation.article-title: Methylocella silvestris sp. nov., a novel methanotroph isolated from an acidic forest cambisol.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Methylocella silvestris sp. nov.
Methylocella silvestris (sil.ves′tris. L. adj. silvestris of the forest).
The description is as for the genus, with the following additional traits.
Optimal growth occurs at 15–25 °C and at pH 5·5.
Carbon sources used include methane, methanol and methylamines.
Utilizes methanol in a wide concentration range, from 0·01 to 5 % (v/v).
NaCl inhibits growth at concentrations above 0·8 % (w/v).
The type strain is strain BL2T (=DSM 15510T=NCIMB 13906T), which was isolated from an acidic cambisol under a beech-dominated forest near Marburg, Germany.
The species also includes strain A1.
